newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan non-life insurer says hopes for NCB recovery.
newsitem.headline: Japan non-life insurer says hopes for NCB recovery.

text.p: Takeo Inokuchi, president of Mitsui Marine & Fire Insurance Co Ltd, said on Thursday that he hopes Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) will recover from its financial difficulties as soon as possible.

"If a big financial institution is in a difficult situation, it would have enormous impact on confidence in Japan's financial system," he told reporters. "I hope Nippon Credit Bank will recover to a healthy condition as early as possible."

Inokuchi, who is also chairman of the Marine & Fire Insurance Association of Japan Inc, said that given NCB's size, it should be fairly easy to win broad support to convert subordinated loans into shares in the bank.

NCB announced a radical restructuring programme earlier this month, in which it asked life and non-life insurers to buy a total of 97 billion yen worth of ordinary new shares, the equivalent of about a half their outstanding perpetual subordinated loans to NCB.
